snippet: Even simple acts like scraping wooden chopsticks together or tapping a soda can before pulling the tab can raise people’s interest in what they are eating or drinking, a series of experiments found.
abstract: Even simple acts like scraping wooden chopsticks together or tapping a soda can before pulling the tab can raise people’s interest in what they are eating or drinking, a series of experiments found.

headline.main: Rituals Make Our Food More Flavorful
